This is an easy way to install Roblox on Linux, just download Grapejuice, install Roblox Player, done! Switched from non flatpak to flatpak, it has gotten much easier to install.

To get the controller working, you need to give permission to all devices using flatseal (you can find an online tutorial) and loging in is a bit weird but possible. You also need to launch not usig the discover app button but on steam / in the main bar.
got stuck at the log in screen
though is does lag at times this app does work and i am able to play roblox. very nice
Used to run really well before I installed the discover flakpack version.
summary: Ran better before being added to discover

It was sorta hard to set up and got my hopes down as it did not enable people to actually play roblox on the website, but through steam. it did work for a bit which was enjoyable, but this has a fatal error which is that it does not update roblox, meaning you have about a week to play on here then never again because the grapejuice launcher has no actual way to update the roblox application manually, or automatically.

description: There are very few options that do what Grapejuice does. Yes it takes some troubleshooting sometimes to get it to work. If you have issues, visit the troubleshooting page on the grapejuice website. If you can't find the answer to your question there, try the discord channel. I found that my main issues in running this were that my wine install wasn't up to date and I needed to download some NVIDIA Drivers. Grapejuice no longer has to be opened through the terminal, which I absolutely love. It works well, but every device and distro is different, so naturally, it may work well for one person right off the bat, while another might have to put some work into getting it to work correctly, or finding work arounds.
i would like it but it constantly crashes
Ever since a couple of updates, Grapejuice has been laggy and unable to enjoy by most users. Please do something about this!!

FYI if your roblox is laging, its because its super outdated (the newest version is v7.8.3 and this is 7.2.1)
https://gitlab.com/brinkervii/grapejuice/-/releases 
to get the new version

description: I am going to uninstall.

For Roblox Player, it works perfectly and performs good considering it's Wine and Roblox games that are optimized are very rare. What bothers me is that this is a Flatpak, meaning you can expect this to work flawlessly due to having the exact version of every necessary and even optional dependancy within reason due to file size, but no; Roblox Studio works in none of the rendering engines on either Wayland or X.org. Also, as of the time I'm writing this, this Faltpak is several minor versions behind the upstream.
I like it b/c it actually works, although it tends to freeze up. and I have to continuously exit out off the app.

steam deck users rating 1 star because "its laggy" don't realize that
1. this is a LINUX system
2. the steam deck isn't the worlds best pc
3. if you turn down the graphics to 11-16 in the studio editor option menu, you get a solid 60 fps while editing (ingame graphics can be changed in settings while testing to get a smooth 60)

overall, really great solution for a problem many people had.

description: so long as you don't run into any issues, it's an easy one click install for people who aren't comfortable or familiar with the terminal like my friends who switched to linux. sometimes the flatpak will not work on your distro and you'll have to install it from the command prompt on their website and sometimes even their custom wine build for better performance
summary: flatpak tends to be outdated, but it's an easy one click install
